docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Nov. 23 about the financial health of state-based insurance exchanges, The Associated Press reported erroneously on the status of a lawsuit filed by the American Council of Life Insurers over the funding of the District of Columbia's health exchange. The suit isn't pending; it was dismissed earlier this month.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s executive action on immigration was almost anticlimactic to many people in California.

headline.main: Turmoil Over Immigration Status? California Has Lived It for Decades
headline.print_headline: Immigration’s Turmoil? California Has Lived It

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's executive action on immigration is seen as anticlimax by many in California, state that has experienced turmoil over immigration for decades; California has already passed various forms of legislation aimed at dealing with its large and well-settled population of immigrants; though it may welcome Obama's initiative, extent of state's illegal population highlights limitations of what he has to offer.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s executive action on immigration was almost anticlimactic to many people in California.

byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles; Ian Lovett from Bakersfield, Calif.; and Vindu Goel from San Francisco. Reporting was contributed by Richard Pérez-Peña from San Francisco, and Matt Hamilton, Brandon Shaw and Kimiya Shokoohi from Los Angeles.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, IAN LOVETT and VINDU GOEL

docs.lead_paragraph: A foster mother who has taken more than 40 children into her Bronx home over the years is struggling to pay the bills.

headline.main: Opening Her Home to Many Children, and Worrying About Keeping Out the Cold
headline.print_headline: Opening Her Home to Many Children, and Worrying About Keeping Out the Cold

docs.abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York, one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Josefina Rodriguez pay expenses related to maintaining household full of foster children.
docs.snippet: A foster mother who has taken more than 40 children into her Bronx home over the years is struggling to pay the bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republicans are not interested in improving any provisions of the Affordable Care Act. They are bent on its destruction.

headline.main: The Piecemeal Assault on Health Care
headline.print_headline: The Piecemeal Assault on Health Care

docs.abstract: Editorial excoriates Republican members of Congress who are determined to destroy Affordable Care Act provision by provision, knowing they do not have the supermajorities they would need to override a presidential veto of a full repeal.
docs.snippet: The Republicans are not interested in improving any provisions of the Affordable Care Act. They are bent on its destruction.

docs.lead_paragraph: A nation is beckoning foreign brains and money with the kind of immigration reform that Silicon Valley can only envy.

headline.main: At Spain’s Door, a Welcome Mat for Entrepreneurs
headline.print_headline: At Spain’s Door, a Welcome Mat for Entrepreneurs

docs.abstract: Stacia Carr, co-founder of online video startup Vidnex, is among small business owners benefiting from Spanish law that grants business visas to foreign entrepreneurs; measure is part of Spain's effort to revamp domestic business amid recession, and offers start-ups a tempting alternative to hyper-saturated environment of Silicon Valley.
docs.snippet: A nation is beckoning foreign brains and money with the kind of immigration reform that Silicon Valley can only envy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Randomized trials are highly effective for suggesting ways to improve health care delivery, but they’re also rare. That may be changing.

headline.main: How to Arrive at the Best Health Policies

docs.abstract: The Upshot; randomized controlled trials are still incredibly rare in research on health care delivery, despite fact that they are gold standard for evaluating effectiveness of drugs; resistance to controlled trials, which may be starting to change, arises from both ethical considerations and practical and political difficulties.
docs.snippet: Randomized trials are highly effective for suggesting ways to improve health care delivery, but they’re also rare. That may be changing.
